alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 08 at 6:03AM MST until May 14 at 12:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR A DAM RELEASE REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST TUESDAY, MAY 16... * WHAT...Flooding caused by upstream dam release continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Arizona, including the following county, Yuma. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MST Tuesday May 16. * IMPACTS...Lowland flooding and inundation of unbridged crossings will occur along the Gila River downstream of Painted Rock Dam. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 602 AM MST, water being released from Painted Rock Dam is traveling through Yuma County, with a USGS gauge in Dateland indicating flows at 9 feet, which is at minor flood stage. These elevated flows will continue to flood unbridged river crossings and may inundate some farmland. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Paloma and Roll. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
